dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, you see where you’re going? Let’s work on how to get there. Pan up to find...CLINT BARTON, with his daughter, LILA, coaching her as she notches an arrow in her bow.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, good...tip down...bow arm out...three fingers-

dialogues.speaker: LILA BARTON
dialogues.text: Why three?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: ‘Cause two’s not enough and four’s too much-

dialogues.speaker: LAURA BARTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You guys want mustard or mayo, or both? CLINT TURNS. IN THE FIELD BEHIND THEM, his wife, LAURA BARTON sets up a picnic as COOPER and NATHANIEL play socc

dialogues.speaker: LILA BARTON
dialogues.text: Who puts mayo on a hot dog?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: We’1l both have mustard, hon! (to Lila) Okay. Draw back, deep breath... She lets loose. THUD! HER ARROW HITS NEAR THE BULLS-EYE.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good job, Hawkeye. Go get your arrow.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA BARTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Enough murder practice! Soup’s on!

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: One sec, babe. Be right there! We’re gonna kill some hot dogs. We're hungry. But when he turns back...LILA IS GONE. The bow and arrow at his feet. He stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila? Babe, did you see Lila- He turns to his wife, BUT SHE’S GONE. So are the boys. Th soccer ball rolls to a stop near the picnic blanket. NO ONE CAN BE SEEN FOR A HUNDRED YARDS IN ALL DIRECTIONS.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys? Guys, come on... Clint walks toward the field, dread growing.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Laura? Clint breaks into a panicked run.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS.
dialogues.text: TITLE: “TWENTY-TWO DAYS LATER.” Soon, THE BENATAR tumbles past, adrift...

dialogues.text: TONY STARK and NEBULA play table-top football. She wins.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (offering his hand) Good sport. Have fun? Nebula studies his hand, confused. Finally she shakes.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: It was fun.

dialogues.text: THE BENATAR sparks, adrift.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you’re ever going to see these. I don’t even know if you’re still...God, I hope so. Today’s day twenty-one, no...twenty- two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEBULA lasers shut Tony’s infected wound.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You know, if it wasn’t for the existential terror of staring into the literal void of space, I’d say I’m feeling a little better today. Infection’s run its course, thanks to the Blue Meanie back there. You’d like her. She’s very practical. And only a tiny bit sadistic.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The fuel cells were cracked during battle, but we figured out a way to reverse the ion charge. Bought ourselves about 48 hours of flight time. Problem is that was about...49 hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means, we’re dead in the water. A thousand light years from the nearest 7-1l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony hands Nebula the last of A PURPLE POWDER. She pushes back to him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Most of the quote-unquote ‘food’ and potable water ran out two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony stands on the flight deck, one hand resting on the glass, staring into the unknown.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Pep, I know I said no more surprises. But, I gotta say, I was really hoping to pull off one last one. But it looks like...well, you know what it looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to now. Tony records his thoughts into his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Don't feel bad about this. I mean, actually, if you grovel for a couple weeks, and then move on with enormous guilt...I should probably lie down for a minute, rest my eyes. Please know, when I drift off, it will be like every day lately. I’m fine, totally fine. I’m going to dream about you. It’s always you. Tony switches the helmet off.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: NEBULA finds TONY SPRAWLED ON THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Nebula helps Tony into Quill’s chair. Tony slumps, completely still. Nebula gives him his privacy. Move in on Tony’s face as...A LIGHT SLOWLY GROWS BRIGHTER Soon, the entire flight deck glows as bright as a sun. Nebula appears from the galley, shading her eyes. Tony’s eyelids flutter. Finally, he opens them to see... CAPTAIN MARVEL (CAROL DANVERS) hovering in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE ROGERS shaves. He studies himself in the mirror, exhausted. He’s about t tap his razor in the sink’s standing water, when... THE WATER RIPPLES. Steve stares a beat, puzzled. Then the lamp catches his eye...SWAYING GENTLY. Just then, a sound roars overhead. Steve turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MOON HANGS HUGE OVER THE EARTH. Then the silhouette o THE BENATAR races past, propelled by CAROL DANVERS. Below...STEVE ROGERS, BRUCE BANNER, AND NATASHA ROMANOV w a flying woman guide the ship to the ground. Behind them, PEPPER POTTS walks up to the group.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Steve races up as NEBULA helps Tony down the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I couldn't stop him.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Neither could we.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I lost the kid.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (unable to say it all) We...lost...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Is Pepper...?  JUST THEN, PEPPER POTTS THROWS HERSELF INTO TONY’S ARMS.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: Stay here, you stay right here-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere. NEARBY, NEBULA watches the sad humans. ROCKET SITS BESIDE HER, GRATEFUL. She rests a hand on his furry head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RHODEY, TONY, STEVE, NATASHA, AND CAROL watch... A HOLO-DISPLAY ROTATING THROUGH FACES OF PEOPLE WE’VE LOS WANDA. VISION. BUCKY. T’CHALLA. MARIA HILL.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: It’s been twenty-three days since Thanos came to Earth. TONY, weak, sits in a hi-tech wheelchair, IV dripping int his arm. He stares, taking in the loss: SAM WILSON. SECRETARY ROSS. SHARON CARTER. SCOTT LANG. HOPE VAN DYNE. HANK PYM. NICK FURY. At Fury, Carol bites back emotion.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: World governments are in pieces, as you can imagine. But the parts that still work are trying to take a census. It looks like he did what he said he was going to do.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY. QUILL. DRAX. MANTIS. GROOT. PETER PARKER.
dialogues.text: Finally, Tony looks away. RHODEY turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanos wiped out fifty percent of all the living creatures on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: Not just Earth.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never have to ask me that.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We don’t know. He just opened a portal and walked through. Tony looks out to see...THOR on the patio.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What’s his deal?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s pissed. Tony turns to see Rocket for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He thinks he failed. Which, of course, he did. But there’s a lot of that going around, ain’t there?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Until this second, I literally thought you were a Build-a-Bear.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We've been hunting Thanos for three weeks - deep space scans, satellites - we got nothing. Tony, you fought him-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Who told you that? I didn’t fight him, he wiped my face with a planet while a Bleecker Street magician gave away the store. There was no fight because he’s not beatable.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Did he give you anything to go on? Clues, coordinates-— Tony stares, lost, barely acknowledging Steve.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I saw this coming, few years back. Didn't wanna believe. I thought I was dreaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, I need you to focus-—

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: And I needed you, as in past tense. That trumps what you need. It’s too late, buddy. You know what I need? Tony turns to everyone, slightly unstable.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need a shave and a burger, not a bowl of soup. (stands) And I believe I remember telling all of you, alive and otherwise, that we needed a suit of armor around the world, whether it impacted our precious freedoms or not-—

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: But that didn’t work out, did it?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I said we'd lose, you said we'd “do that together, too.” Guess what, Cap, we lost, and you weren’t there. But that’s what we do, right? Our best work after the fact? We’re the “Avengers”, not the “Pre-vengers-”"

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Tony, take it easy...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’ve got nothing for ya, Cap. No coordinates, no clues, no strategies, no options. Zero, zip, nada. No trust. (rips out RT) Here. You take this. You find him, you put this on, and hide. (drops to his knees) I’m fine! Tony COLLAPSES. Rhodey catches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL, STEVE, AND NATASHA stare through GLASS DOORS at TO IN A HOSPITAL BED, PEPPER AND BANNER AT HIS SIDE. RHODEY STEPS OUT OF THE HOSPITAL ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Bruce gave him a sedative. Should be out the rest of the day.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: (heading for the lab) Take care of him. When I come back, I’1l bring a bottle of Xorrian elixir.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: To kill Thanos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATASHA catches up to CAROL IN THE WORKSHOP.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hang on. We’re sort of a team here. Between you and me, morale’s a little fragile.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry. My fault. Carol sees Steve and Rhodey catch up. She claps her hands

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right, team! I’m going to go kill Thanos. Message me if you get any intel that can help. Otherwise, I’1l report back when he’s dead. Great work, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Look, we realize “up there’s” more your territory, but this is our fight, too.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Do you even know where he is?  10

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: I know people who might-

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t bother. They all turn to see NEBULA in THE LIVING AREA DOORWAY.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can tell you where Thanos is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE, NATASHA, RHODEY, BANNER, ROCKET, THOR, and CAROL gather. NEBULA studies her robotic hand.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: Thanos spent a long time trying to...perfect me. When he worked, he talked. About his Great Plan. Even disassembled, I wanted to please him. I’d ask, where would we go once his plan was complete? His answer was always the same: “To the Garden.”

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You're saying Thanos had a retirement plan.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Where’s this garden? ROCKET brings up EARTH on A HOLO-MAP. A BRIGHT SURGE OF ENERGY ENVELOPS THE PLANET (EMANATING FROM WAKANDA) .

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: When Thanos snapped his fingers, Earth become ground zero for a power surge of ridiculously cosmic proportions. No one’s seen anything like it. He shifts the map, crossing billions of light years, to.. IDENTICAL SURGE ENVELOPING A MYSTERIOUS, ORANGE PLANET.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Until two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: You're saying he snapped his fingers again. Where?  11 Rocket zooms the holo-image toward a cluster of stars...

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: Planet is unnamed, but inhabitable. Rich atmosphere, good soil-

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: A garden.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE BANNER
dialogues.text: Thanos is there. And he just used the stones. Steve eyes everyone. THOR FINALLY LOOKS UP.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE BANNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (thinking of himself) You know, we'd be going short- handed.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Because he killed all our friends.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Are we saying they’re dead? We're using that word now?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: He’s still got the stones.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: So, we take them. And we use them to bring everybody back.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE BANNER
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just like that. No one speaks. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: If there’s even the smallest chance we can undo this, then we owe it to everyone who’s not sitting here to try. Everyone looks around the room...AGREED.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE BANNER
dialogues.text: If we do this...why would it end any differently than it did before?  12

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: Because before you didn’t have me.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Hey, new girl. All of us in here are about that superhero life. Where’ve you been all this time?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: There’s a lot of people in the universe. And they didn’t all have you. THOR STANDS. He crosses to Carol and holds out his hand. STORMBREAKER WHIPS PAST HER HEAD, RUFFLING HER HAIR. Carol doesn’t flinch. Thor smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: I like this one. Steve stares at the planet a long, deciding moment. Then.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Let’s go get that son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM TO
dialogues.text: TITLE: “AVENGERS: ENDGAME”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE settles into their seats on the Benatar’s flight deck. STEVE WATCHES EARTH GROW SMALLER THROUGH THE WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: Trust me. You get used to it. ROCKET looks around from the pilot’s chair.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Okay, who here hasn’t been to space? STEVE, NATASHA, and RHODEY half-raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re gonna hate this.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: Approaching jump in three, two... STEVE’S FINGERS TIGHTEN on the arm rest as...  13

dialogues.speaker: WHOOSH
dialogues.text: As the ship maintains orbit, CAROL flies toward the plane

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: I’1ll head down for recon. If I’m not back in fifteen, you’1l know I found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUR HEROES wait on the flight deck, tense. NATASHA looks at STEVE, who’s staring at...A COMPASS: PEG CARTER’S YELLOWED PHOTO STILL RESTS INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: This is going to work, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I know it will. (beat) Because I don’t know what I’m going to do if it doesn’t. JUST THEN, CAROL FLIES UP TO THE OTHER SIDE OF THE GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS, (OVER COM)
dialogues.text: No satellites, no ships, no armies. No ground defenses of any kind. It’s just him.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: That’s enough. The Avengers exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: SMOKE CURLS FROM THE CHIMNEY OF A SOLITARY LODGE.
dialogues.text: INT. THANOS’ LODGE - DAY A POT BOILS OVER A FIRE. Then...THANOS LIMPS TOWARD IT, L SIDE PARALYZED, arm blackened. A shell of his former self  14 He stirs the pot. Suddenly, AN ARMORED HAND BURSTS FROM T FIRE, GRABBING THANOS’ GAUNTLET... PREVENTING THANOS FROM CLOSING HIS FIST. Thanos jerks back as HULKBUSTER SPRINGS INSIDE. CAROL AND RHODEY BASH THROUGH THE ROOF, PINNING THANOS’ ARMS. THOR crashes through the door, followed by the others. HE SWINGS STORMBREAKER...CUTTING OFF THANOS’ HAND. The Gauntlet lands at Rocket’s feet. He picks it up...and his face goes slack. He turns the glove toward the others And we now realize...THE INFINITY STONES ARE GONE.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Where are they? Thanos doesn’t answer. CAROL PRESSES HIM TO HIS KNEES.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS
dialogues.text: Answer the question!

dialogues.speaker: THANOS
dialogues.text: The universe required correction. After that, the stones served no purpose beyond temptation.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE BANNER
dialogues.text: You murdered trillions.

dialogues.speaker: THANOS
dialogues.text: You should be grateful.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Where are the stones?

dialogues.speaker: THANOS
dialogues.text: Gone. Reduced to atoms.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE BANNER
dialogues.text: You used them two days ago!

dialogues.speaker: THANOS
dialogues.text: I used the stones to destroy the stones. It nearly killed me. But the work is done. It always will be. That lands, sickening. ROCKET SEARCHES, FRANTIC, NEAR TEA

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: No...they can’t be gone...  15

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: He’s lying.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: My father is many things. A liar is not one of them.

dialogues.speaker: THANOS
dialogues.text: Thank you, daughter. Perhaps I’ve treated you- SWOOSH. THOR’S AXE SEVERS THANOS’ HEAD FROM HIS BODY. IT HITS THE FLOOR, FOLLOWED BY THE THUD OF HIS HUGE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: What did you do? Thor just stares, his long journey a failure.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: I went for the head. As Thor walks away, Steve looks at Thanos’ head on the ground. IT’S OVER. THEY LOST. FADE TO BLACK. OVER BLACK: “FIVE YEARS LATER.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR CRUSHER flattens an Audi. THOUSANDS MORE NEVER-DRIV CARS LIE STACKED ON THE DOCKS, WAITING THEIR TURN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE TARP flaps over the shuttered LINCOLN CENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEENAGE GIRL rides her skateboard, alone in a weed-fill parking lot. Pull back to see THE EMPTY STADIUM BEHIND HE

dialogues.speaker: A POSTER SHOWS A SINGLE FIGURE STARING AT A GROUP OF SHAD
dialogues.text: IT READS, “WHERE DO WE GO, NOW THAT THEY’RE GONE?” The bottom reads, “BROOKLYN SUPPORT GROUP, TUESDAYS 8PM.”  16 A GRIEVING MAN speaks in A RECOVERY GROUP.

dialogues.speaker: GRIEVING MAN
dialogues.text: So, I went on a date the other day.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Good job, Bobby. Back in the game.

dialogues.speaker: GRIEVING MAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jimmy. (to the group) First in five years. I sat there at dinner thinking, what are we even supposed to talk about? STEVE ROGERS, thinner, older, LISTENS INTENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What did you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: GRIEVING MAN
dialogues.text: Same old crap. How much things have changed. How much we miss the Mets. My job, his job. Then it got kind of quiet. He cried during the salads.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: GRIEVING MAN
dialogues.text: I cried just before dessert. But I’m seeing him again tomorrow. So...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That’s great. You’ve already done the hardest part. You took a jump, didn’t know where you’d come down. And that’s it, those little brave baby steps we’ve gotta take. To try to make us feel whole again, to find a purpose... (to everyone) I went into the ice right after I met the love of my life. Woke up seventy years later and...had to keep going. The group takes this in.  17

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The world’s been left in our hands. If we don’t do something with it...then Thanos might as well have killed all of us. People nod, but Steve seems unconvinced by his own words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA ROTATES down from the sky onto a strangely qui San Francisco, until it finds...A STORAGE WAREHOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUIS’ VAN sits in a storage unit, surrounded by boxes: “S LANG, KITCHEN, S. LANG, CLOTHES.” THROUGH THE VAN WINDOWS, we see...HANK PYM’S QUANTUM TUNN

dialogues.speaker: A MEANDERING RAT CRAWLS ONTO THE CONTROLS. IT ACCIDENTALL
dialogues.text: STEPS ON A TOGGLE SWITCH and...A LIGHT GOES GREEN. FLASH. THE BACK DOORS OF THE VAN BLOW OPEN, revealing...SCOTT LA ANT-MAN suit shorting. He retracts his helmet, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD reads THE TERMINAL BEACH, by J.G. Ballard. He loo up at a monitor: SCOTT LANG holds up a sign, “HELP.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dented WAGON rolls over a speed-bump. Scott, in his old clothes, slowly wheels his belongings away. The Guard watches him go, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott walks A STREET OF ABANDONED HOMES.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Hello? He hears A CLACKING. A KID on a bicycle rides by, playing card wedged between his spokes. Scott waves him down. The kid stops.  18

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Kid. What happened here? The kid says nothing. He just stares at Scott with a haun look. Then he stands on his pedal and keeps riding. CLACK-CLACK-CLACK-CLACK-CLACK-CLACK-CLACK. ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STONE MONUMENTS loom in a park. A small crowd mills. Reve Scott looking over the monuments, lost.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Scott walks up to the obelisks. At the top, they read: “T VANISHED.” Hundreds of names line the stones. He scans the “L's,” finally finding, “SCOTT LANG."

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: What? (realizing) Cassie... EXT. MAGGIE LANG’S HOUSE - DAY A winded Scott races up the sidewalk toward his old house He leaps a bush, banging on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Cassie! Cassie! SOON, A TEEN GIRL opens the door, shocked. A very long be

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE LANG
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Peanut? Scott wraps his arms around CASSIE LANG (14), now five ye older than when he last saw her. She hugs him, CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE LANG
dialogues.text: I thought you were gone.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m back...I’m back...I’m back...  19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avengers Compound stands amidst overgrown grass. Rusty chains lock the gate. Faded signs warn: “RESTRICTED AREA. KEEP OUT.”

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: We boarded that “highly suspect warship” Danvers pinged.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: It was an infectious garbage scow.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: So thanks for the hot tip-

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: You were closer.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: And now we smell like garbage-

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: (to Okoye) You get a reading on those tremors?

dialogues.speaker: OKOYE, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: Minor subduction in the African plate.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Do we have a visual? How are you handling it?

dialogues.speaker: OKOYE, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: Nat. It was a mild earthquake. In the ocean. We handle it by not handling it. Natasha looks burdened. Rhodey steps in.  20

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: I can have NASA redirect a satellite, do a sweep just to make sure.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Thanks. Carol, you’re still coming our way next month?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: Not likely.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: Getting another haircut?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL DANVERS, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: Listen, fur-face, I’m covering a lot of territory out here. The things that have been happening on Earth have been happening everywhere else. On thousands of planets. You might not see me for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: All right. Everybody keep keeping their eyes open. This channel's always active. Anything goes sideways, anyone makes trouble where they shouldn't, it comes through me. They ad lib their goodbyes as they sign off, except Rhode

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s up? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY, (HOLO)
dialogues.text: Mexico. Got some news.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Federalés found a room full of bodies outside Juarez. Cartel guys. Guns still in their pants.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Could be a rival hit-

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: But it wasn’t. Same MO as Marseille. And Kiev. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) It’s definitely Barton. She nods, grim, reluctantly accepting.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What he’s done here...what he’s been doing...I got to tell you, part of me doesn’t want to find him. Natasha just stares a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Find out where’s he going next. Rhodey nods, signing off. Natasha sits there, THEN CRUMPL After a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'd offer to cook you dinner but you seem sad enough already. Natasha turns to see STEVE in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Come by to do your laundry?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: And see a friend.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Your friend’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: She leave the house today?

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Nothing out there I particularly want to see.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I spotted a pod of whales coming over the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: (dubious ) In the Hudson.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Fewer ships, cleaner water. Just saying, there’s still a world out there.  22

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: If you’re about to tell me to look on the bright side, I’m about to hit you with a peanut butter sandwich. Steve relents, LETTING DOWN HIS FACADE.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Force of habit.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: I don’t know how you do it. Steve bites into the uneaten half of her sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I guess I don’t know how not to.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Me, neither. After a long moment, Steve looks up at her, honest.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I keep telling them, move on. Grow past it. And some of them actually do. But not us.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: If I move on, who does this?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Maybe it doesn’t need to be done. Natasha takes that in. Steve is thinking of giving up. Sh looks around at Avengers Compound.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: I used to have nothing. Then I got this. This job, this family. And I was better because of it. She chokes slightly, collecting herself.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And even though they’re gone, I’m still trying to be...better.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I think we both need to get a life.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: You first.  23 They stare at each other a long, melancholy moment.

dialogues.speaker: THEN, WE HEAR A PING. NATASHA SWIPES TO A CCTV DISPLAY
dialogues.text: SCOTT LANG’S FACE FILLS A SCREEN, LUIS’ VAN BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Hello? Is anyone home? This is, uh, Scott Lang? We met a few years ago. At the airport?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: This an old message?

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: (stunned) It’s the front gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTT paces, mumbling to himself.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Scott, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: What? Yes. He turns to STEVE and NATASHA.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have either of you guys ever studied quantum physics?

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Only to make conversation. Steve glances at her. She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Well, five years ago, just before this Thanos guy...I went into a place called the Quantum Realm. It’s like its own microscopic universe. You can only get there if you're incredibly small. Hope, she’s my...she was supposed to pull me out. But then Thanos happened. And I was stuck in there.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It must’ve been a long five years.  24

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: (getting excited) Okay, but that’s the thing. It wasn’t. For me, it was only five hours. The rules in the Quantum Realm aren’t like out here. They're completely unpredictable. Is anybody gonna eat that sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Scott, what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Time works differently in the Quantum Realm. Steve and Natasha share a look.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Problem is, right now, it’s chaos, there’s no way to navigate it. But what if we could figure out a way to enter the Quantum Realm at a certain point in time...and come out in another. Like, before Thanos—

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Wait...wait. Scott. Are you talking about a time machine?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: No, not a machine. More like a... (searches, then gives up) Yeah, like a time machine. I know it sounds crazy...

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Scott, I get emails from a raccoon. Nothing’s crazy anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: So, who do we talk to about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLAMAS and FARM ANIMALS GRAZE A RUSTIC-TECH ECO-COMPOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY approaches A WOODED GLADE near the house.  25

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Morgan H. Stark. Chow time. Want some lunch? Silence. Then MORGAN STARK (4) steps out of her play tent wearing A PURPLE-BLUE IRON MAN HELMET (RESCUE).

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Define lunch or be disintegrated.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You should not be wearing that. It’s part of a special anniversary gift I made for Mom. You thinking about lunch? Tony gently takes the helmet off, revealing A YOUNG GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where'd you find this?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Garage. Tony picks her up, walking toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You like going in the garage? So does Daddy. It’s all right. Mommy never wears what I buy her.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Tony and Morgan exit the woods. Suddenly, Tony stops. In the driveway, STEVE ROGERS stares at him. NATASHA AND SCOTT GET OUT OF THE CAR BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE, SCOTT, and NATASHA sit with TONY.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I just want to thank you folks for dropping by. It’s not every day one gets to contemplate biting it on an inter-dimensional timescape.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: You've got some objections to the plan.  26

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: So you're calling it a plan. To me, it sounds like an exotic suicide method. Not to mention, it’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: We know what it sounds like.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Tony, after what you’ve seen, is anything really impossible?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Quantum fluctuation kinda messes with the Planck Scale, which then triggers the Deutsch Proposition, can we agree on that? (offering more tea) Chai? (back on message) In layman's terms, it means you can cancel your Netflix subscription because you’re not coming home.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Which was a billion-to-one cosmic fluke. Now you want to pull a- What are you calling it?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: A time heist.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Oh, of course, a time heist, why didn’t we think of this before? Right, because it’s a pipe dream. Who are you again?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Still Scott...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Tony, the Stones exist in the past. We could get them and bring them here.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: We can snap our own fingers. We can bring everybody back.  27

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Or screw it up worse than he already has.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I don’t believe we would. Tony stares at Steve, a lot of water under the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Gotta say it. Sometimes I’ve missed that giddy optimism. Sadly, all your high hopes won’t help me if there’s no logical, tangible way for me to safely execute said “time heist.” I believe the most likely outcome would be our collective demise.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Not if we strictly follow the rules of time travel. No talking to our past selves. No betting on sporting events-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Stop, Scott. Stop. Are you telling me that your plan to save the universe is more than loosely based on Back to the Future?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: (meaning “yes”) No...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Good. Because that would be horseshit. Scientifically speaking, your brother's picture doesn’t disappear just ‘cause you went to the dance with your mom. That’s not how quantum physics works.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: We have to take a stand.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We did stand. And yet here we are.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Look, Stark- Can I call you Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don’t-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Tony-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: I get that you’ve got a lot on the line, here. You’ve got a wife. A daughter. But I lost someone very important - a lot of us did - and now we have a chance to save her, and everyone else, and you won’t even-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No, Scott. I won’t. Even. Suddenly, MORGAN walks onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Mommy told me to come save you. Tony takes Morgan into his arms and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Good job. I’m saved. (to Steve) I wish you were coming here to ask me something else. I’m honestly happy to see you. If you want to stay- Steve tries one last time.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Tony, I get it. And I’m happy for you. I am. But this is a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I got my second chance right here. I can’t roll the dice on it. The table is set for six. If you don’t talk shop, you’re welcome to stay for lunch. He exits.  29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, Natasha, and Scott walk toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: He’s scared.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He’s not wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do? We need him. You want to stop?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No. I want to do it right. (beat) We're going to need a really big brain.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Bigger than his?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONLOOKERS crowd a diner window, trying to peek inside.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m confused.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: These are confusing times.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: No, that’s not what I’m-

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I'm kidding, I get it. It’s crazy. I wear shirts now!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Five years ago, we got our asses kicked, right?  30 Smart Hulk eats a stack of pancakes in two bites.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He’s heard.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: It was worse for me. Because I lost twice. First Hulk lost. Then Banner lost. Then we all lost.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: No one blamed you, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I did- I feel like I’m the only one eating. Here, try some. He holds out a pizza. They decline. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thing is, I kept thinking, it didn’t have to be that way. That the best of Banner and best of Hulk, if they’d worked together, maybe they could’ve stopped Thanos.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Okay. But how did...this happen?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: For years I treated the Hulk like a disease, something to get rid of. But when I started treating him like the cure... Smart Hulk MESHES HIS FINGERS together.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eighteen months in the Gamma Lab. I put the brains and the brawn together. And now look at me. Best of both worlds. TWO KIDS amble up to the booth.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Mr. Hulk? Can we get a picture?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: 100%, little lady. The kid hands a phone to Steve. SMART HULK makes a duck f as Steve sheepishly snaps the pic, handing the phone back  31

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the fan) Thanks, pal. Hulk out!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: So, Bruce, about what we said-

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: The time travel do-over? I don’t know, that’s kind of outside my field of expertise... Natasha nods at his Smart Hulk-ness, history between them

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: You pulled this off. I remember a time that was impossible, too. He considers, then finally relents, pulling out his phone

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I’m supposed to be on Oprah next week, but I guess I could move things around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY STARK DOES DISHES. He rinses with the sprayer. It go everywhere. He wipes down the counter, including... A PICTURE OF PETER PARKER. He stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony builds HOLO MODELS: Penrose diagrams, wormholes. He studies a STAR-SHAPED CAPACITOR, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Friday, you up?

dialogues.speaker: FRIDAY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I've had a mild inspiration, like to see if it checks out. I would like to run one last sim before we pack it in for the night. This time, in the shape of a Mobius Strip, inverted.  The model 32

dialogues.speaker: FRIDAY
dialogues.text: Processing. forms.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: All right, give me the eigenvalue of that particle, factoring in spectral decomp. Run it. That’ll take a second. And don’t worry if it doesn’t pan out, I’m just kind of...

dialogues.speaker: FRIDAY
dialogues.text: Model rendered.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (in awe) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shit. Tony turns to see HIS DAUGHTER in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What are you doing up?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: First of all, that’s a Mommy word, she coined it.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Why are you up?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I just had something on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Was it juice pops?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Correct. Great minds think alike. What kind do you want?  33 INT. STARK ECO-COMPOUND, MORGAN’S ROOM - NIGHT Morgan eats A JUICE POP in bed. Tony watches.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You done? (finishing her popsicle) Now you are.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Tell me a story.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Once upon a time, Maguna went to bed. The end.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: That was a bad story. He runs his hand over her hair.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Love you tons.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN STARK
dialogues.text: Love you three thousand.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Wow, that’s a lot. Tony turns out the light, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHOTOS crowd a side table: Pepper, Morgan, Tony. Even one

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD STARK, PEGGY CARTER
dialogues.text: Find...PEPPER, curled up on the couch reading. Then...

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Out like a light. Don’t know how much she loves you but she loves me three thousand.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: That’s up there.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What’re you reading?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: A book about composting-  34

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I think I solved it. Pepper looks up.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: Just so we're both talking about the same thing-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Time travel.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: That's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: And terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: To say the least. He sits beside her. She stares, SHARING IN HIS DILEMMA.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: We got really lucky-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I know-

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: Not everybody did.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I can’t help everybody.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: Except, it sort of seems like you can.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Not if I stopped right here.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: Tony, trying to get you to stop is one of the few failures of my life.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I could just lock the lab, put it in a trunk, sink it to the bottom of the lake, and go to bed.  35

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER POTTS
dialogues.text: But could you rest?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: You're sure these modifications are safe? He looks over to...SMART HULK, WEARING READING GLASSES, MAKING ADJUSTMENTS TO A NEW CONTROL PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I reran my calculations three times-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Because the guy who invented this thing is pretty much a genius-

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I have seven PhD’s, an MD, the Hans Bethe Award for Physics, and I’m personal friends with Bill Nye the Science Guy. We’re good.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Yeah. And you look like that on purpose. STEVE and NATASHA enter from outside.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Breakers are set, emergency generator’s on stand-by.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Good. If we blow the grid, I don’t want to lose Tiny back in the ‘50's.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: He was kidding.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I was kidding.  36

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: (to Hulk) You were kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Honestly, I have no idea. We're attempting time travel. Either it’s all a joke, or none of it is. (loudly to Scott) We're good! Helmet on. Scott puts on his helmet, slightly dubious.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m going to send you back one week, give you an hour to look around, then bring you back in ten seconds. Make sense?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Perfectly not confusing.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Good luck, Scott. You’ve got this.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: (inspired) Yes, I do, Captain America. Yes, I- SMART HULK PULLS A LEVER. SCOTT SHRINKS TO NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Counting down from three, two, one... SUDDENLY SCOTT REAPPEARS...BUT HE’S 12-YEARS-OLD.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Uh, guys? This doesn’t feel right.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Is that Scott?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Probably...? He scrambles, hitting buttons. SCOTT SHRINKS TO NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Get him back! Smart Hulk flips a switch. SCOTT REAPPEARS...AT AGE 93.  37

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Oh, my back!

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Bruce! Get it under control. What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I got it, I know exactly what’s going on. Pretty much. SCOTT SHRINKS TO NOTHING AGAIN. HULK TYPES FRANTICALLY wi A PENCIL, fingers too big for the keys. 2-YEAR OLD SCOTT APPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It’s a baby.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: It’s Scott.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: As a baby! Smart Hulk hits a button. Baby Scott disappears.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: When I tell you, kill the power! (throwing a switch) Now! NATASHA KILLS THE POWER. Normal Scott stumbles off the pa

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Somebody peed my pants. I don’t know if it was baby-me or old-me. Or just me-me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve leans on the wall, discouraged. Then he hears AN ENGINE ROAR. AN AUDI races up the drive. It stops, the window rolling down to reveal...TONY.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Why the long face? Wild guess, he turned into a baby?  38

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Among other things.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (getting out of the car) EPR Paradox. Instead of pushing Lang through time, you were pushing time through Lang. It’s dangerous. I probably should've cautioned you against it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Thank god, I’m here. Regardless, I fixed it. He holds up...HIS STAR-SHAPED CAPACITOR.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is a fully-functioning, time- space GPS. I just want peace. Resentment is corrosive. I hate it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Me, too. Something eases between them, for the first time in years

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We've got a shot at the Stones. I just need you to know my priorities. Bring back everyone we lost, hopefully. Keep what I found, definitely. And, let’s not die trying. Steve looks at Tony. Finally, he offers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Sounds like a deal. They shake. This is a long time coming. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: But wait, there’s more. Act now, and it comes with a bonus offer. Tony pops the trunk. Steve stares, moved, at...HIS SHIELD

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Tony, I don’t know-  39

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What’s to know? He made it for you. Plus, I gotta get it out of the garage before Morgan takes it sledding. Steve finally picks up the shield, SLIDING IT ONTO HIS AR

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Tony. Tony chokes up, then covers by slamming the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Just don’t flaunt it. I didn’t bring enough for the whole team. We are getting the whole team, right?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We're trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTT sits on a bench, eating a hardshell taco. THEN A MASSIVE EXHAUST WIND BLASTS HIM, blowing his taco away. THE BENATAR lands outside AVENGERS COMPOUND. NEBULA AND ROCKET EMERGE. Rocket waits at the end of the gangway.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Hey, Humie. Where’s Big Green?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Um, kitchen, I think. Scott tries a smile at Nebula. She just hits her COM:

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA, (INTO COM)
dialogues.text: Rhodey, careful on re-entry. There’s an idiot in the landing zone. She goes in. THEN, WHAM, WAR MACHINE LANDS, STARTLING SCO

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: What’s up, Regular-Sized Man? Rhodey goes inside as SMART HULK walks out, carrying an overnight bag. He hands Scott some tacos.  40

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Finally. I ain’t got all day.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I call shotgun! As he walks up the Benatar’s gangway, PRE-LAP A METALLIC SCRAPING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scraping goes on as we see...A NORWEGIAN FISHING VILL Tilt to a sign: “NEW ASGARD,” in English and ASGARDIAN RU A PICK-UP passes, scraping the pavement: SMART HULK AND ROCKET SIT IN BACK, WEIGHING DOWN THE TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: What the heck are they looking at?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I’m kind of famous...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m sure that’s it. Kind of a step down from golden palaces and magic hammers...

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: They lost Asgard, then half their people. Maybe they’re just happy to have a home.

dialogues.speaker: VALKYRIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have come. VALKYRIE approaches from the pier. Smart Hulk GRINS.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Hey, Valkyrie! Great to see you! He goes for a hug...VAL DOESN’T. She studies the new him.

dialogues.speaker: VALKYRIE
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I liked you better either of the other ways.  4l

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: This is Rocket.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: VALKYRIE
dialogues.text: Hey. (to both) He won’t see you.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: We didn’t say we were here to see-

dialogues.speaker: VALKYRIE
dialogues.text: Great, then you can hose out the gut buckets-—

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: We're definitely here to see him.

dialogues.speaker: VALKYRIE
dialogues.text: He can’t give you what you need.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: It’s that bad?

dialogues.speaker: VALKYRIE
dialogues.text: We only see him once a month. When he comes in for “supplies.” She nods to A DOZEN BEER KEGS STACKED OUTSIDE A PUB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart Hulk and Rocket knock on the door of A CABIN. Nothi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMART HULK opens the door. PIZZA BOXES and LIQUOR BOTTLES litter the floor. Rocket recoils.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Something died in here.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Hello...? Thor...?

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you here about the cable? We hear a HEAVY SHUFFLING as someone approaches.  42

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cinemax went out two days ago, and the sports are all...fuzzy... THOR enters, CONFUSED, A LITTLE DRUNK, SHIRTLESS...AND TREMENDOUSLY FAT. Rocket and Hulk stare.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Thor?

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: BROS! Bring it in! Thor hugs Smart Hulk. He turns to Rocket, who steps back.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Hulk, you know my boys, Korg and Miek, right? KORG and MIEK sit on the couch, playing Playstation 4.

dialogues.speaker: KORG
dialogues.text: Beer’s in the bucket. Feel free to log on to the WiFi.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. Long time no-

dialogues.speaker: KORG
dialogues.text: Thor! This kid on the TV just called me a dickhead!

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Noobmaster again?

dialogues.speaker: KORG
dialogues.text: NoobMaster69 called me a dickhead- Thor snatches KORG’S HEADSET and hisses into the mic.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Noobmaster, this is Thor, again. God of Thunder. This is your last warning. Log off this game or I will come to your basement, rip off your arms and shove them up your butt. (handing the headset back) Right, who wants a drink?  43 SMART HULK AND ROCKET JUST STARE. Thor pulls a beer from fridge, and whacks the cap against STORMBREAKER.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Don’t I look all right?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: (under his breath) You look like melted ice cream-

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: So, what’s up? Just here for a hang?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: We need your help. There’s a chance we can fix everything.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Like the cable? It’s driving me bananas.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Like Thanos. THOR GRABS HULK’S SHIRT, INTENSE. KORG RISES FROM THE COU

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Don’t say that name.

dialogues.speaker: KORG
dialogues.text: Yeah, we don’t say that name in here. Smart Hulk looks down at THOR’S HAND STILL ON HIS SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Please take your hand off me. Thor looks into Hulk’s eyes...and gently removes his hand

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, I know the thought of...that guy might scare you-

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Scared? Why would I be scared of that guy? I’m the one who killed that guy, remember? (looking around) Anyone else here kill that guy? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Didn't think so. Korg, tell everyone who chopped Thanos’ head off.

dialogues.speaker: KORG
dialogues.text: Stormbreaker? Thor uncaps a whiskey bottle. BLAM, IT SHATTERS IN HIS HA Reveal...ROCKET, BLASTER SMOKING.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Not. Cool. Man.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Don’t. Care. Dude.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Look, I get it. You’re in a rough patch. I’ve been there. But you know who helped me out of it?

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Was it Natasha?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: It was you. You helped me. And I need you to help me again.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Ask the Asgardians down there how much “my help” is worth.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: At least they’re alive-

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: They were gods! Now they’re fisherpeople! (sagging into a chair) The ones that are left, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: That’s the thing. I think we can bring them back. Thor's tempted, but shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Stop. Stop. I know you think I’m down here, wallowing in my own self- pity, waiting to be rescued. But I'm fine. I’m happy. Whatever it is you're offering, don’t care. Couldn’t care less.  45 Hulk and Rocket stare at Thor.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Come on, pal. We need you. He still can’t meet their gaze. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: There’s beer in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: (beat) What kind?

dialogues.speaker: OF THEIR TATTOOED HANDS.
dialogues.text: TITLE: “TOKYO.”

dialogues.speaker: GUNFIRE FLASHES AS THE FIGHT CONTINUES PAST THREE WINDOWS
AKIHIKO
dialogues.text: (Japanese, subtitled) Why are you doing this? We never did anything to you!

dialogues.speaker: RONIN
dialogues.text: (Japanese, subtitled) You survived. Half the planet didn’t. They got Thanos. You get me. Akihiko attacks. Ronin slashes him across the middle.

dialogues.speaker: RONIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Japanese, subtitled) You’re done hurting people. Akihiko gestures at the bodies in the street.

dialogues.speaker: AKIHIKO
dialogues.text: We hurt people? You’re crazy. Ronin slashes Akihiko’s throat. The man drops to his knee

dialogues.speaker: AKIHIKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Help me! I’1l give you anything! What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: RONIN
dialogues.text: What I want...you can’t give me. Ronin finishes him off. AKIHIKO GOES STILL. SIRENS WAIL. Ronin removes his mask, revealing... CLINT BARTON, haggard. He hears A FOOTFALL. He whirls, katana raised...then stops. His face goes slack as...

dialogues.speaker: KEEPING HER FROM THE RAIN.
dialogues.text: They stare at each other. Clint hasn’t seen her in years. She hasn’t seen what he’s become.  47

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Neither should you.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: I’ve got a job to do.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: That what you’re calling this? She moves even closer. He stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Killing these people isn’t going to bring your family back. (beat) We found something. A chance, Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Don’t what?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: Give me hope.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: I’m just sorry I couldn’t give it sooner. CLINT DISSOLVES, sagging into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOR STANDS WITH A BEER IN A COZY, staring at A NEW QUANT TUNNEL (2.0), AFFIXED WITH TONY’S CAPACITOR.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Out of the way, Lebowski. Thor shuffles aside as Tony blows past.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Ratchet, you get lost in there?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s Rocket, and shut up. You’re only a genius on Earth, pal.  48

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: And you're only in there because you have tiny hands. ROCKET, COVERED IN GREASE, WRIGGLES OUT A HATCH.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Fixed it.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Get used to saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMART HULK fits SCOTT with A BRAND NEW TIME SUIT. NEBULA ASSISTS. RHODEY enters the workshop, eyeing the suit.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Time travel suit, I like it. SMART HULK awkwardly tries to fit a pair of RED TEST TUBE INTO THE TIME SUIT’S BELT.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Easy, easy. Careful with those.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I'm being very careful-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: You're being very Hulky- Scott takes the tubes from him and inserts them, himself.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are Pym Particles. You can’t shrink to the Quantum Realm without them, and since Hank Pym got snapped out of existence, we can’t make any more. I told you. We’ve only got enough for one round trip each, no do-overs. Scott gently clicks the tubes into their housing.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Plus two test runs— SUDDENLY, SCOTT SHRINKS INTO NOTHING, THEN GROWS BACK. He takes that in...  49

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One test run. (embarrassed) Okay, maybe I’m not ready.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m game. They turn to see CLINT leaning in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: NOW, CLINT WEARS THE TIME SUIT. Scott looks on, sulky. SMART HULK, RHODEY, and NEBULA attach the Pym housing.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Okay, Clint, you might feel a little disoriented when you chronoshift-

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Hang on, I’ve got to ask, if we can do this, why don’t we just go find baby Thanos and, you know... Rhodey makes a STRANGLING GESTURE.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Uh, one, because that’s horrible. And, two, killing baby Thanos doesn’t kill adult Thanos. Time doesn’t work like that. You can’t change the future by changing the past.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Sure, we can. We take the stones before Thanos gets them, then he doesn’t have them. Problem solved.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: That’s not how it works.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. That is kind of what I’ve heard-

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Heard from who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star Trek. Terminator. Bill and Ted’s Excellent-

dialogues.speaker: WHY DOES EVERYONE THINK THIS
dialogues.text: THAT’S NOT TRUE. IF YOU TRAVEL TO

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT HAS BECOME THE PAST, WHICH
dialogues.text: NOW CAN’T BE CHANGED BY YOUR NEW

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Scott leans over, whispering:

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Apparently, Back to the Future is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: Look, are we doing this or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 CLINT WAITS ALONE ON THE PLATFORM, WEARING THE TIME SUIT. SMART HULK readies THE QUANTUM CONSOLE as ROCKET, RHODEY, NEBULA, THOR, and STEVE look on.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Okay, Clint. Starting in three, two, one... Clint nods over at them, determined. SUDDENLY, SHRINKS, AND VANISHES. WHOOSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the slats of a barn, we see a tractor. FLARES, REVEALING CLINT BARTON IN A TIME SUIT.

dialogues.speaker: ENERGY
dialogues.text: He walks to the open door, staring at...HIS OLD HOME.  51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint climbs the porch. He accidentally kicks...A BASEBAL MITT. Then he hears VOICES. He stares into the house through THE SCREEN DOOR. From th sounds of it, LAURA and THE KIDS are making dinner. HIS DAUGHTER LAUGHS. Clint’s face crumples. Just then...H QUANTUM CUFF VIBRATES. A SCREEN COUNTS DOWN: 0:03.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: No. Not yet... (opening the door)

dialogues.speaker: BUT HIS BODY STARTS TO GLOW. 0.01- CLINT VANISHES. THE
dialogues.text: SCREEN DOOR SLAMS. After a moment, LILA runs in.

dialogues.speaker: LILA BARTON
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLINT APPEARS ON THE PAD, SHAKEN. TONY and NATASHA approa

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Hey, look at me. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Tell me something good... Clint looks up, tearful. He holds out THE BASEBALL MITT.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: It worked. It worked. Reveal Steve, Smart Hulk, Nebula, Rhodey, Scott, Thor, an Rocket, looking on.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Holy crap. We’re freaking time travelers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a HOLO-BOARD: “MIND, SPACE, TIME, POWER, REALITY, SOUL Above each word hovers...ITS ARTIFACT: LOKI’S SCEPTER, THE TESSERACT, THE EYE OF AGAMOTTO, THE O THE AETHER CONTAINER, AND A QUESTION MARK.  52

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Okay. Now that we’ve got how, we're going to need where and when.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA, TONY, RHODEY, SCOTT, SMART HULK, ROCKET, NATASHA,
dialogues.text: CLINT look on.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most folks here have encountered at least one of the six Infinity Stones—

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I think you mean nearly been killed by one of the six Infinity Stones.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: I haven't. (off their looks) Just...saying.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Regardless, we’ve only got enough Pym Particles for one round trip, each. And the Stones have been in a lot of places throughout history.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Our history. Not all of them are going to be a fun drop-in.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: Which means we’ve got to pick our targets.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Exactly. (he taps “REALITY” ) Let’s start with the Aether. Thor, what do we know? Everyone looks toward...THOR, slumped over.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Is he asleep?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure he’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: THOR sulks, looking at the Aether Container Holo: “REALIT Locations are listed: “SVARTALFHEIM, KNOWHERE, LONDON.”  53

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: The Aether’s not a stone, it’s more of an angry sludge. My grandfather hid it from Dark Elves in a rock between dimensions that can only be accessed every 5000 years. HIS ROBOTIC EYE drifts off in the wrong direction. Thor bangs his head, resetting his eye.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or...by Jane. She stuck her hand in a rock. Then the Aether stuck itself inside her. Then I took her to Asgard. We were dating... (depressed) We’re not anymore. Everyone stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a holo image of THE ORB: “POWER.” Locations are listed: “MORAG ?-2014, KYLN 2014, XANDAR 2014-2018.”

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Quill said he stole the Power Stone from Morag. He paces on top of the table, past SMART HULK EATING A PI OF “HUNKA HULKA BURNING FUDGE.”

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: That’s a person?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: It’s a planet. Quill was a person.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Wait, like a planet...in space? Rocket pinches Scott’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Aw, look. It’s like a puppy, all happy and everything. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to go to space, puppy? I’ll take you to space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, Steve, Natasha, Clint, Rocket, and Smart Hulk sit quietly, listening to Nebula.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: Thanos found the Soul Stone on Vormir.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: And that is...?

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: A dominion of death at the very center of celestial existence. (beat) It’s the place where Thanos murdered my sister. That hangs heavily. A moment passes. Then...

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT LANG
dialogues.text: Not it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, Natasha, and Smart Hulk hash it out.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: So this ‘Time Stone’ guy...what kind of doctor was he?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Strange?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Cross between ear-nose-and-throat and rabbit-from-hat.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Had a nice place in the Village.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sullivan Street.  55

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Bleecker.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Sullivan and Bleecker. They’re cross streets.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Wait, he lived in New York? Guys, pick the right year and there were three stones in New York.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: (beat) Shut the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE blocks our view.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Okay, we have a plan. Six stones, three teams, one shot. He steps away, revealing the board...

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE EYES THE TANGLE OF LINES CONNECTING SIX STONES T
dialogues.text: FOUR LOCATIONS TO TWO YEARS TO TEN HEROES. IT’S INSANE.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Five years ago, we lost. All of us.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We lost friends. We lost family. We lost a part of ourselves. (beat) But today we have a chance to take it all back. Steve takes in the groupings of heroes: RHODEY & NEBULA, & CLINT, THOR & ROCKET, TONY & SCOTT.  56

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have your teams and you have assignments. Get your stone, and get back here. One round trip each. No mistakes. No do-overs. He grips HIS SHIELD.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most of us are going back to places we know. That doesn’t mean we know what to expect. Be careful. Look out for each other. Improvise, if you have to. (looking around) This is the fight of our lives. And we're going to win. (beat) Whatever it takes. The platform stays quiet. Rocket WHISPERS to Scott:

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: He’s pretty good at that... Scott nods enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (to Smart Hulk) All right, you heard the man. Stroke those keys, Jolly Green. Smart Hulk taps in commands with HIS PENCIL. LIGHTS ILLUMINATE EACH PAD.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Tracking beacons engaged. Clint checks his pocket: A SHRUNKEN BENATAR sits inside.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: You promise to bring that thing back in one piece?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure thing. I’11 do my best.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: That’s pretty lame, as far as promises go.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLATFORM BEGINS TO VIBRATE. NATASHA LOOKS AROUND.
NATASHA
dialogues.text: See you in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Actually, it'll be closer to seven or eight microseconds, give or-

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY, THEY STRETCH AND VANISH, SHRINKING AWAY. WHOOSH
dialogues.text: THE QUANTUM CONSOLE STOPS VIBRATING. HULK’S PENCIL SLOWLY

dialogues.speaker: AVENGERS GATHER IN A CIRCLE, FACING IMPOSSIBLE ODDS.
dialogues.text: At the same time, just a block away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! STEVE, SMART HULK, TONY, and SCOTT arrive at the mouth of an alley, just out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Okay, Park Avenue’s that way. Let’s huddle up. Suits off. They all touch their cuffs, RETRACTING THEIR TIME SUITS.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We've all got our assignments. Two stones uptown, one stone down. Stay low, keep an eye on time- Just then, Al HULK BOUNDS DOWN THE STREET SMASHING THINGS

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Bruce? Maybe smash a few things along the way. For appearances.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: (taking off his shirt) All right, but I have to say, it seems gratuitous. He half-heartedly smashes a few cars.  58

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grrr...grrr...

dialogues.speaker: THE VILLAGE. SUDDENLY...BOOM, THE CHARIOTS EXPLODE.
dialogues.text: ON ONE SIDE OF THE SANCTUM ROOF, A TINY, HOODED FIGURE hu jagged mandalas into the sky. ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE ROOF...SMART HULK LANDS. He head for a door, but...

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'd be careful going that way... He turns to find...THE ANCIENT ONE STARING AT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We just had the floors waxed. SMART HULK THINKS, THEN GROWLS, TRYING TO INTIMIDATE HER.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Hulk...does what...Hulk want?

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE
dialogues.text: Yes, I suppose that would be the case- JUST THEN, ON THE ROOF OPPOSITE, Al HULK TACKLES A CHITAU CHARIOT, RIPPING IT IN HALF. HE ROARS, LEAPING AWAY. Smart Hulk blinks, sheepish. The Ancient One looks at him

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Care to explain?

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I’m looking for Dr. Strange.

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE
dialogues.text: You're about five years too early. Stephen Strange is currently performing surgery, 20 blocks that way. What do you want with him? He finally notices THE EYE OF AGAMOTTO HANGING FROM HER N

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: Well, that, actually.  59

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE
dialogues.text: Ah. I’m afraid not.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: I’m seriously sorry but...I wasn’t asking. Smart Hulk cracks his knuckles and moves in. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE
dialogues.text: You don’t want to do this.

dialogues.speaker: SMART HULK
dialogues.text: You're right, I don’t. But I need that stone, and I don’t have a lot of time to debate it- He reaches for it. THE ANCIENT ONE SLAMS HER PALM INTO HI CHEST AND BLASTS BRUCE BANNER RIGHT OUT OF SMART HULK. “ASTRAL BANNER” hangs in the air, staring at his frozen S Hulk body. He looks at his human hands, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRAL BANNER
dialogues.text: No, no, no- She topples Smart Hulk’s body with one finger. Whump.

dialogues.speaker: ANCIENT ONE
dialogues.text: Now. Let’s start over, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: AN ASGARDIAN MAIDEN stands at JANE’S ROOM, handing over A GREEN DRESS.

dialogues.speaker: MAIDEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: For you, Lady Jane.

dialogues.speaker: JANE FOSTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Um, do you have anything with...pants?

dialogues.speaker: MAIDEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pants?

dialogues.speaker: JANE FOSTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Nevermind. Pull back to...ROCKET AND THOR, WATCHING from behind a cr Rocket holds a syringe-like EXTRACTION DEVICE.  60

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: That’s Jane.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Okay, here’s the deal. You’re going to charm her, and I’m going to poke her with this thing, extract the Reality Stone, and get gone lickety-split. Thor looks off in the other direction, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Um, I‘ll be right back. The wine cellar is just down here. My father used to have this barrel of Aakonian ale. Felt like getting hit in the face with a poleaxe. I‘ll see if the scullery has a couple of to-go cups-— They hear SOMEONE APPROACHING. Rocket yanks Thor back as...FRIGGA AND HER HANDMAIDENS ENTER THE CORRIDOR.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGGA
dialogues.text: Send Loki some soup. I don’t think he’s eating. And ask our librarians to pull some volumes from the astronomy shelves. He won't read them, but at least they’1l keep him company. Thor watches Frigga and her coterie disappear down the ha

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Who’s the fancy broad?

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: My mother. She dies today.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Oh, jeez. Thor starts to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: I can’t do this. This is a bad idea. I can’t do this... Rocket climbs onto a marble monument.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Come here.  61 Thor steps closer. ROCKET SLAPS HIM ACROSS THE FACE.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think you’re the only one who’s lost people? What do you think we're doing here? I lost the only family I ever had. Quill, Groot, Drax, the chick with the antenna. All gone. I’ve lived five meaningless years without them, and every minute has blown Aaskvarian gornads. I get you miss your mom. But she’s gone. Really gone. There are plenty of people who are only kind of gone. And you can help them. So, is it too much to ask that you brush the crumbs out of your beard, make shmoopy talk to Prettypants, and when she’s not looking, suck out the Infinity Stone, and help me get my family back? Thor stares at him a long moment. He wipes his tears away

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Thank you. I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Great. As Rocket scurries to Jane’s door, Thor murmurs to himsel

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: I can do this...I can do this... (beat) I can’t do this...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: (peering through keyhole) All right, heartbreaker. This is our shot... Rocket turns to find...THOR NOWHERE TO BE SEEN.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thor? (holding his temples) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can kill him, and say the Elves did it.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: That's it, right on that line, Blue. Keep dropping it. Nearby, CLINT SURVEYS THE PLANET. GEYSERS EXPLODE. CLIFFS LOOM. AN ORLONI bites NATASHA’s boot. She kicks it away.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: (to Rhodey) Hey, can we hurry it up?

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Yeah, come on, chop chop, we’re on the clock, here.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: All that? Really helpful!

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Clint and Natasha board the Benatar. Rhodey and Nebula remain on the planet’s surface.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Get that stone and come back. No messing around. You guys watch each other's six.

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: Coordinates for Vormir are laid in. All they have to do is not fall out.  63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint laughs, watching Natasha expertly pilot a spaceship

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT BARTON
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just...we’re a long way from Budapest.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: (pushing the throttle) Further every second.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: So, all we have to do is hang out, wait for this Quill guy, and follow him to the Power Stone, right?

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: Let’s take cover. We’re not the only ones in this reality looking for the stones.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Hey, who are you talking about right now? Who else is looking for the stones?

dialogues.speaker: NEBULA
dialogues.text: My father. My sister. And me. MOVE IN ON RHODEY, CONCERNED.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads Thanos’ troops onward as they lay waste to the Korbinite home world. JUST THEN...  64

dialogues.speaker: KORBINITE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, THROATS.

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMEN BEAR DOWN ON HER.
dialogues.text: A GREEN BLUR LEAPS IN, SLICING THE RIFLEMEN’S THE TWO HUGE SOLDIERS DROP... GAMORA looking down at her sister. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GAMORA
dialogues.text: You're welcome?

dialogues.speaker: BAD NEBULA
dialogues.text: I didn’t ask for your help.

dialogues.speaker: GAMORA
dialogues.text: And yet you always need it. Father wants us back on the ship. Gamora offers her hand. Bad Nebula stands on her own.
